title: Introduction to Computer Security
description: Introduction course to computer secutity and its main characteristics

chapters.title: Basic Security Requirements
chapters.description: CIA paradigm for information security estabilishes 3 requisites

concepts.name: Confidentiality
concepts.description: The information can be accessed only by authorized entities

concepts.name: Integrity
concepts.description: The information can be modified only by authorized entities and in the way they are intended to do it

concepts.name: Availability
concepts.description: The information must be available to all the parties who have a right to access it, within specified time constraints

questions.question: Which of the following is not a CIA paradigm component?
questions.explanation: CIA paradigm components are Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability

chapters.title: Vulnerabilities VS Exploits
chapters.description: The difference between vulnerabilities and exploits

concepts.name: Vulnerability
concepts.description: Something that allows to violate one of the constraints of the CIA paradigm

concepts.name: Exploit
concepts.description: A specific way to use one or more vulnerabilities to accomplish a specific objective that violates the constraints

questions.question: Which of the one exploits the other?
questions.explanation: Exploits are a specific way to use one or more vulnerabilities to accomplish a specific objective

chapters.title: Assets VS Threats
chapters.description: The difference between assets and threats

concepts.name: Assets
concepts.description: An asset identifies what is valuable for an organization. It can be of many tipes, such as hardware, software, data, reputation

concepts.name: Threats
concepts.description: A potential violation of CIA; circumstance potentially causing a CIA violation. For example denial of service, identity theft, data leak.

questions.question: What is valuable for an organization?
questions.explanation: An asset identifies what is valuable for an organization

questions.question: A laptop can be an asset for an organization
questions.explanation: Hardware can be valuable for an organization

chapters.title: Attacks VS Threat Agents
chapters.description: The difference between attacks and threat agents

concepts.name: Attack
concepts.description: is an intentional use of one or more exploits with the objective of compromising a system's CIA.

concepts.name: Threat Agent
concepts.description: whoever/whatever may cause an attack to occur

concepts.name: Attackers, Hackers...
concepts.description: Hacker: someone with an advanced understanding of computers and computer networks, and willingness to learn everything. Attackers are NOT hackers

questions.question: Picking a lock to enter a building can be considered as an attack
questions.explanation: It is an intentional attempt to compromise integrity

questions.question: An attacker is an hacker
questions.explanation: An attacker is not a hacker

chapters.title: Security as Risk Management
chapters.description: The risk is statistical and economical evaluation of the exposure to damage because of the presence of vulnerabilities and threats

concepts.name: Formula to calculate risk
concepts.description: Risk = Asset x Vulnerabilities x Threats

concepts.name: Security vs. Cost Balance
concepts.description: Security can be seen as a balance of the reduction of vulnerabilities + damage containment vs cost

concepts.name: Indirect costs (more relevant)
concepts.description: Less usability, slower performance, less privacy, reduced productivity

questions.question: Is Management a direct or indirect cost?
The risk increases if the vulnerabilities increases
questions.explanation: Risk = Asset x Vulnerabilities x Threats
